param.name: type
param.label: MGF Input Type
param.help: Submit either a single file, or a collection of files.

param.name: CHUNKSIZE
param.label: Size to split fasta for parallel processing

param.name: THREAD_LIMIT
param.label: How many threads to use per node

param.name: JVM_Xmx
param.label: Maximum memory allocated to each Java thread

param.label: Minimum memory allocated to each Java thread

param.label: Filter the database using MetaNovo algorithm

param.label: Number of allowed missed cleavages

param.name: fixed_mods
param.label: Fixed modifications as comma separated list

param.name: variable_mods
param.label: Variable modifications as comma separated list

param.name: annotation_level
param.label: The intensity threshold to consider for annotation
param.help: Using percentiles, 0.75 means that the 25% most intense peaks will be annotated.

param.name: annotation_high_resolution
param.label: The type of the intensity threshold

param.name: sequence_matching_type
param.label: The peptide to protein sequence matching type

param.name: sequence_matching_x
param.label: The maximal share of Xs in a sequence

param.name: import_peptide_length_min
param.label: The minimal peptide length to consider when importing identification files

param.name: import_peptide_length_max
param.label: The maximal peptide length to consider when importing identification files

param.name: import_precursor_mz_ppm
param.label: The maximal precursor precursor deviation to allow when importing identification files

param.name: exclude_unknown_ptms
param.label: Peptides presenting unrecognized PTMs will be excluded

param.name: ptm_score
param.label: The PTM probabilistic score to use for modification localization

param.name: score_neutral_losses
param.label: Include neutral losses in spectrum annotation of the PTM score

param.name: ptm_sequence_matching_type
param.label: The modification to peptide sequence matching type

param.name: ptm_alignment
param.label: Align peptide ambiguously localized PTMs on confident sites

param.name: useGeneMapping
param.label: Use and save gene mappings along with the project

param.name: updateGeneMapping
param.label: Update gene mappings automatically from Ensembl

param.name: protein_fraction_mw_confidence
param.label: Minimum confidence required for a protein in the fraction MW plot

param.name: directag_ms_charge_state
param.label: Use charge state from M spectrum

tool.help:
**MetaNovo**
MetaNovo searches MS/MS data against a FASTA database of known proteins.
Two outputs are produced:
- MetaNovo Output FASTA: the matching proteins produced by the search. - MetaNovo Output CSV: information about the job and other useful metadata.
Two inputs are required: an MGF file or files and a FASTA database file.
Two different input types are available for the MGF input. The correct input configuration depends on the desired use case, as outlined below:
======================================================= ============= Use case Configuration ======================================================= ============= Single input MGF file, single output FASTA file **Single file** input with **Single dataset** selected Multiple input MGF files, multiple output FASTA files\* **Single file** input with **Multiple datasets** OR **Dataset collection** selected Multiple input MGF files, single output FASTA file **Collection** input ======================================================= =============
**\*** One for each MGF file.
In the second use case, a separate MetaNovo job is spawned for each input MGF. In the third use case, a single MetaNovo job runs with all MGF files in the collection as input.
